column3:
Before:

```
$ ./src/bitcoin-cli getinfo
error code: -32601
error message:
Method not found
```

After:

```
./src/bitcoin-cli getinfo
error code: -1
error message:
getinfo

This call was removed in version 0.16.0. Use the appropriate fields from:
- getblockchaininfo: blocks, difficulty, chain
- getnetworkinfo: version, protocolversion, timeoffset, connections

Tested ACK b9be8e3f93b0c796d27e1e15e573950098da625f.

`getinfo` was not removed using the phased deprecation suggested in #10841. This seems like a good enough alternative.

Agree with @ryanofsky that `RPC_METHOD_NOT_FOUND` is the appropriate error rather than `RPC_MISC_ERROR`.

If you were being ultra zealous, you could add the following to deprecated_rpc.py:

```python
utACK b9be8e3f93b0c796d27e1e15e573950098da625f\n\nI would also prefer that this use JSONRPCError than just a runtime error.
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12198/commits/b9be8e3f93b0c796d27e1e15e573950098da625f, agree with above comments though
Changed the error code to RPC_METHOD_NOT_FOUND\nb9be8e3 â†’ 49e5f3f
